website_summaries.verdict: A wider than average sisal scratching surface combined with a thick, sturdy loop places this hanging cat scratcher a cut above the rest.
pros: Pure woven sisal fibers deliver excellent durability, minimal mess, and – most importantly – a satisfying scratching experience for felines
Boasts a generous scratching surface and a long, sturdy hanging loop
cons: Latex backing is only useful on floors

customer_reviews.title: Having second thoughts
customer_reviews.text: Bought one of these, watched my little one dive into it vs the furniture and immediately ordered a second one. These are great! 2.19 UPDATE: I got down on my hands and knees to eyeball one of these just now (about three weeks after purchasing.) Thin fibers that I can barely see are starting to sprout up. Some quite long. Now I’m concerned they might end up in my cat’s mouth and throat. I trimmed as much of them as I could with sissors. Here’s a photo showing two of the fibers. Will monitor closely.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: The truth is that the mat itself is great. However
customer_reviews.text: The truth is that the mat itself is great. However, my 14 year old cat refuses to use it to scratch on, just as she refuses to use a scratching post. I have tried enticements such as catnip on both, but she prefers area rugs to my great chagrin. But I did want to give this product an excellent review, since it is super nice and hopefully other cats get the concept that has eluded my cat!!
customer_reviews.author: patti  walker

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff, will buy again
customer_reviews.text: Cat took to it immediately, knows what it's for and uses it for a flop, too. It has some weighted rubber feet to keep it down and in place, which I wasn't expecting. Good stuff, will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Roller

customer_reviews.title: So much cleaner than cardboard.
customer_reviews.text: So much better than the corrugated cardboard scrathers I've purchased in the past. It satisfies the cats and doesn't create a mess. Also very durable so far.
customer_reviews.author: NMARK

customer_reviews.title: Saved the carpet
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my cat started scratching at the carpet in the bedroom at night when she wanted to wake me up. I put it in the spot that she scratches, so now she isn't damaging the carpet. It's noisy when she scratches on it and she still wakes me up, but the carpet is safe so I guess we both win. It's thin enough that I can open the door over it and it stays in place well without sliding around.
customer_reviews.author: Mkad

customer_reviews.title: We double knotted the top to make it higher and it’s worked like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Our cavapoo scratches at the door when we leave the house. It ruins the door, frame, and paint piles up on the floor! Found this thing and all that has stopped. We double knotted the top to make it higher and it’s worked like a charm!
customer_reviews.author: CED

customer_reviews.title: The cat will decide what he wants to do
customer_reviews.text: You never know about a cat. My cat immediately took to this rug. However he likes it as a bed, not as a scratching mat. He guarded this mat from the other cat all evening the first day and has consistently slept on it ever since. Although I would have liked for him to use it as intended, I am happy he likes it so much
customer_reviews.author: Kohaku Lea

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my cat room. Very sturdy. Great product Update: The rooe that is holding around the door has began to come apart. still holding strong though. I will buy another when this fully breaks. But i will keep this scratch pad as a mat to ly on the floor for the cats to still use as extra
customer_reviews.author: Katelyn

customer_reviews.title: Functional
customer_reviews.text: Looks great as a door mat and doubles as a scratch mat for my cats. I like that it has a non slip back and has held up very well with little need to clean up after their scratching.
customer_reviews.author: Arpster

customer_reviews.title: Cat's love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Wish I could have gotten this in an area rug size other than that I have nothing bad to say about. All 3 of my cats love running their talons across it. Definitely saves my legs from becoming a target.
customer_reviews.author: Mar

customer_reviews.title: CHEMICAL SMELL
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 cats and not one of them would go near this thing. It wreaks of a chemical odor which I believe comes from the backing. Don't waste your money - IF you choose to return you only get a fraction of your expense back - and this worthless thing is expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Cats are happy!
customer_reviews.text: I added the 20" x 20" size to the bottom of a large sisal scratching post, covering the hard base. Cats are happy!
customer_reviews.author: Pilar

customer_reviews.title: This looks great
customer_reviews.text: This mat looks like it really would work... if my cat weren't so picky about where he scratches. He likes scratching the frame of doors, but God forbid he scratches a couple of inches to the right instead. Unfortunately, this wasn't a cure for my family, but it might be for yours. It really helped my mom's cats a few years ago, so I thought it might work for me too. The product itself is a little flimsy, almost like you picked up a piece of thin carpet, but it seems sturdy enough to deal with kitty claws.
customer_reviews.author: Faith Hall

customer_reviews.title: Cat approved
customer_reviews.text: Our very finicky cat likes it. We rigged it to curve downward at the entry “door” to her covered litter box to underneath the litter box because she hates having pieces of litter in her paws and this helps her get them out. She used to try to get them out by scratching at the plastic edge at the bottom of the door hole of the litter box but this is much better. With the loops of the scratcher it could also be hung from a doorknob but she likes it at the litter box “exit”.
customer_reviews.author: Craig C.

customer_reviews.title: My cats loves it almost as much as he loves my carpet
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because my cat would not stop scratching the carpet in my bedroom. I placed it exactly at his favorite spot of scratching, and luckily he kind of adopted it. Meaning he scratches the mat more than the carpet. Do not ask me why the cat would still sometimes prefer to scratch around the mat... <-cats-> ... But he loves this product for more than just scratching. He would lie on the mat from times to times and rubs against it. The mat is very sturdy and will not lose pieces (unlike my carpet...). Nice product, definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Nina Segura

customer_reviews.title: perfect for our carpet scratcher
customer_reviews.text: besides the sound of a cat vomiting, the next sound that will get you to bolt upright out of bed is a cat scratching something other than intended. so it was with noir who loves to scratch the carpet behind the bed. solution was simple. placed this mat atop of the spot and problem solved. well, she still wakes me up, but i don't need to give a shout for her to stop!
customer_reviews.author: Calikatz

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't attract cats to scratch
customer_reviews.text: Nicely finished sisal mat. None of our 5 cats have taken to using it with their claws which is why we bought it. One or two of them like rest on it. However, we already have enough cat beds.
customer_reviews.author: Smilinguy

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, great price
customer_reviews.text: My kitten hasn’t entirely noticed it yet but the product itself is great quality and hangs exactly where it needs to for my cat to reach it. I had to steam it when it arrived since it does ship rolled up and wasn’t laying flat at first. No biggie. I honestly might frame this fabric and mount it to a wall since I like that aesthetic better, but this is a SUPER good find for quality sisal for cheap. I think hanging on the door it doesn’t look like an eyesore there to me either. I’m just a designer so I think I might take it a step further. I would recommend. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: A solution to a plastic-eating cat
customer_reviews.text: I had a nice enough rug in front of my cat's litter box, but my cat likes to eat plastic. She would flip it over and eat the rubber backing. She also is a furniture scratcher but is terrified by every scratching post I have tried, so I thought - sisal - rug - why not? Well, she is not eating it. It's a great rug, comfortable to stand on. The only flaw in my genius idea is she is not using it to scratch.
customer_reviews.author: Tonstant Weader

customer_reviews.title: Hit or miss
customer_reviews.text: It's a really nice quality mat.... my cat just doesn't care about it. Important to pay attention to if your cat mostly scratches at the floor or prefers scratching things higher up on a couch to replace that. My cat needed a tall item for his scratching. Hoping I can re purpose this somehow.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work! Wont stay on the ground as the cat scratches
customer_reviews.text: This mat is useless as a scratching surface because it lifts off the floor as the cat draws their claws up. I'm going to need to glue it to a rectangular piece of plywood or something if there's any hope of it being useful.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan K

customer_reviews.title: Great for Cats
customer_reviews.text: Not something I'd typically consider to meet my cat's scratching needs. However, after watching them destroy a few throw rugs, this seemed like a better option. It's held up well despite their insistence on destroying things. It looks nice and feels nice under foot, with the added bonus of appealing to their scratching instincts.
customer_reviews.author: priusapril

customer_reviews.title: Well made. As described. I’d buy it again.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality!!! I’m impressed. I paid extra for the multi-color option. I’m not thrilled it cost more. However, it looks much better in the house. My kitten is begging to like it. He’s never walked on a surface like that so he’s taking it slow (he’s a timid baby). He has scratched on it. So I think he likes it.
customer_reviews.author: rose kolodny

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves the scratch pad. He either sits on it to claim it as his. Or scratches it - so it’s doing the trick as an alternative to scratching the rug.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen MacKinnon

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye Sofa - Hello Scratch Mat
customer_reviews.text: Our very odd cat has been scratching the mats.... instead of the sofa, the dining room chairs, and the carpet. Seems to like them very much. We bought one to test, and now we have three. He’s even napping on them. We had already tried the posts, the flat bars, and the cardboards with no joy. Fingers crossed the mats continue to hold his interest.
customer_reviews.author: Gracie

customer_reviews.title: cat loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My cat likes to scratch all the time. He has a scratching post & we have tried various other things, but sisal mats are the only think he'll use consistently, and the only thing that make him happy enough to stop also scratching other things, like the carpet on our stairs.
customer_reviews.author: Rumsita

customer_reviews.title: Save your rugs by buying this scratching mat
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Sisal Cat Scratching Mat because my cat had started to scratch on one of my area rugs. When it arrived, I put it on top of the rug and he took to it very quickly and has stopped what would have resulted in having to buy a new rug but now he uses this mat. I recommend this product to all indoor cat owners.
customer_reviews.author: Marie D.

customer_reviews.title: This Saved My Rug!
customer_reviews.text: I love this mat and so does my cat. She had taken to scratching on the nice wool rug in front of the door so I got this mat in hopes that she'd use it instead. I put it in one corner of the rug and it worked like a charm. She never scratches on the rug anymore and even though she has 2 other scratching posts it's her favorite place to go and scratch now. It stays in place unless the door moves it a little and it looks like it will last a while. I'd definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: K.E.

customer_reviews.title: Cat does not scratch, but instead avoids the mat
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased the scratching mat for my cat to scratch on, but my cat avoids the scratching mat like a plague instead. So I placed it over a carpeted area in front of my bathroom to prevent my cat from scratching it. I utilized the scratcher for a completely opposite purpose and it serves it's anti-scratch purpose well.
customer_reviews.author: Dan S

customer_reviews.title: Good quality mat
customer_reviews.text: Looks great, I love the color and feels durable. I will be hanging this on a wall so my cat can scratch it while reaching up high and stretching. He likes to stand on his hind legs and scratch things that are about 3 feet high and it is hard to find a scratch post that is that tall. I think this will work out just great
customer_reviews.author: Katniss

customer_reviews.title: Attractive and durable
customer_reviews.text: I have this on a blank side of my desk where junk would usually accumulate, and the cats really like it. It's a scent-soaker right next to where I hang out and they chill with me on it a lot of the time. They scratch at it a lot, and it was deinitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Tabby

customer_reviews.title: My cat doesn't use it
customer_reviews.text: My cat uses a scratching post, but she doesn't recognize this product as being for scratching. Complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: MarianC

customer_reviews.title: Cats like it more when it’s on the floor.
customer_reviews.text: The packaging was nice and the product looks great and durable. I have 2 cats. Huey, my won’t-leave-my-furniture-alone-no-matter-how-much-kitty-tape-is-involved cat, doesn’t really like it. Louie, the normal one, doesn’t like when it’s hanging on the door. He prefers when I place it on the floor looped under a kitchen chair leg. They both prefer the triangle cardboard scratcher more.
customer_reviews.author: Lizard

customer_reviews.title: Take the hanging thing off, and screw it to the wall or door frame
customer_reviews.text: This is what I've used for years. Take the stupid hanger off, and the other's had a flat board with rope around it, this one was blendable, but do what we did..take off the rope to hang it, and screw it into the wall! They love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon truth

customer_reviews.title: Small
customer_reviews.text: Very small it's basically useless because when they scratch it it pulls off the floor
customer_reviews.author: LiZee

customer_reviews.title: Gonna Buy Again!
customer_reviews.text: Cats love this! It keeps them from tearing at my carpet. I have one in front of the front door, going to buy one for the back door and probably the basement door. It is sturdy, the cats have killed 3 scratching posts since I purchased this a couple months ago, and this doesn't have any wear to it yet! I highly recommend this scratching mat!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick B Rooney

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn't say they love it but it seems to stop them from scratching ...
customer_reviews.text: Both my cats were scratching on it within an hour of being on the floor. I wouldn't say they love it but it seems to stop them from scratching the carpet as much.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley  M Stearns

customer_reviews.title: Good quality scratch mat
customer_reviews.text: My cat has not been very interested in this mat unfortunately, but the mat itself is good quality sisal which is common on many scratching posts. The one time my cat used it while it was hanging from a doorknob, it held up great and she was able tot get her nails in it in the way she usually does on her scratch posts, she just never went back to it after that. I would still recommend it for the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Taryn C

customer_reviews.title: I found a good use for this mat
customer_reviews.text: My cats were not scratching on this so I used it to cover the bottom of their stand up scratching post that had a slick MDF platform on the bottom which they used to slip on. It has been great for this purpose but I wouldn't purchase again expecting my cats to scratch on a flat mat.
customer_reviews.author: KLBRN

customer_reviews.title: Very useful but not large enough.
customer_reviews.text: Cols be a lot bigger and do a better job. OK for the size but would like it to cover more area. My cats act like they are digging ditches and the litter box needs more surrounding coverage. I have very big cats.
customer_reviews.author: percussion Lady

customer_reviews.title: Kitten will not scratch it
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping my kitten would use this for her scratching, but no. She would rather try to eat the fibers that sit up on it. I sprayed it with catnip in an attempt to get her to use the mat, but still nothing. She prefers our rugs. Still searching for something that works with her.
customer_reviews.author: Mountainmamma

customer_reviews.title: I don't know why...
customer_reviews.text: My cat isn't interested. She claws the cardboard ones (which I hate because they make a mess), but doesn't seem as excited about the mat. I like the mat better because it doesn't make such a mess and it is very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Lavender Bluebird

customer_reviews.title: Our Cat Appreciates This
customer_reviews.text: Our cat frequently uses this, sometimes as a scratching pad, sometimes as a place to sit and look around her world. She won't use it hanging from a door knob for some reason, but definitely likes it on the floor. Glad we got it for her.
customer_reviews.author: The Craig

customer_reviews.title: Great for scratchers.
customer_reviews.text: One cat likes to scratch on the carpet, so I bought this for her. Both cats enjoy it. I received this about a week ago, so can’t answer to its durability.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Works really well
customer_reviews.text: My cat had demolished my couch and chair and I had tried everything to get her to stop. This was the only thing that worked. Does she still scratch my furniture? Very rarely. She pretty much sticks to scratching this mat.
customer_reviews.author: C. B.

customer_reviews.title: Tightly woven and attractive
customer_reviews.text: My cats love it. A little for scratching, but mostly just to sit on. Oh well, it’s attractive on my simulated hardwood floor.
customer_reviews.author: G-Man

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, we’ll made scratch pad!
customer_reviews.text: Thick, heavy and great for under food bowl! Kitty loves to scratch at eating time. I thought I would have to secure to the floor but it is very solid and without any additional carpet tape she can scratch away.
customer_reviews.author: Jami Rudd

customer_reviews.title: This is a better cat liter box mat.
customer_reviews.text: This rug isn't big enough for cats to scratch it. It's very small, however works nicely as a doormat for the cat liter box.
customer_reviews.author: HorseGirlCalifornia

customer_reviews.title: Mat is what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Mat is what I expected. Shipped as I was told. It has been in place for 3 weeks now and my cat won't use it. She walks over it, to get to the correigated cardboard scratchers which I hoped this mat would replace. Haven't tried removing the cardboard yet but know I should. Otherwise, I would rate this a five-star.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Brown

customer_reviews.title: Stopped cat from scratching wall
customer_reviews.text: My cat was scratching up some very wide moulding in a doorway between rooms. I nailed these to the walls where the scratching was happening. He doesn't scratch on these, but he doesn't scratch the wall anymore either. I'll call that a win.
customer_reviews.author: NCM NJ

customer_reviews.title: Great mat, but my cats ignore it.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a very nice mat and was shipped promptly. Unfortunately, so far my cats have ignored it. I thought they would take to the sisal immediately. I was unsure what rating to give; very nice, well-made mat but my cats ignore it.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Moore

customer_reviews.title: Cat lives it. I wall mounted it.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something for space saving even though its made for hanging. I screwed it to the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Very nice made, sturdy for my boy, and has soft backing so won't scratch door or cabinet. Harley already tried to use while it was laying on couch. Product deserved 5 stars except was shipped as signature needed, and had to drive to UPS to pickup since we work nights and sleep during delivery time. Would recommend, will be using in our motorhome.
customer_reviews.author: Katerobin

customer_reviews.title: Very long lasting
customer_reviews.text: It's very durable and great! My cats are ripping up my carpet under the door trying to get in so we placed this under the door and it worked like a charm! They scratch the mat instead and it hasnt worn out at all.
customer_reviews.author: Tatiana

customer_reviews.title: Its ok
customer_reviews.text: My cats aren't thrilled about this but will use it every once in awhile. I have it hanging on my bathroom door for them to scratch on. Some cats may like it, some may not.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy L. Ballard

customer_reviews.title: Cat doesn't like it
customer_reviews.text: Cat will not touch it. Put it in the same spot as a cardboard one we used to hang that he loved. I thought this would be more practical instead of replacing the cardboard one all the time
customer_reviews.author: jazarewicz

customer_reviews.title: the mat does not grip very well so it slides easily on my laminate flooring
customer_reviews.text: One of my two cats took a liking to it. It will scratch or rub itself on it. However, the mat does not grip very well so it slides easily on my laminate flooring. The mat is SMALL! Photo is a little deceiving.
customer_reviews.author: Lastofsept

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves it
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking everywhere for this mat for my cats. No one seems to have them in my area anymore. Glad I found it. It's the same quality I used to find on pet stores
customer_reviews.author: lady g

customer_reviews.title: Good for a blind cat
customer_reviews.text: I adopted a blind cat at 10 years old. Don't know if she ever knew what a scratching post was but I couldn't get her to use it. But she does use this scratching mat and it also acts as a point of reference for her. I leave it in the same spot on the floor and she uses it when she gets to it in her travels. It is well made and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine McLeod

customer_reviews.title: Great mat!
customer_reviews.text: Great mat. Sides are nicely bound and a good size. Both cats already like it, laying and scratching on it. Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Knight

customer_reviews.title: Works better than ANY scratching device!
customer_reviews.text: My huge cat has NEVER used any kind of scratching device, only the carpet, uses this! I'm so happy! I'd love to purchase the larger one!
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Saved my new carpet.
customer_reviews.text: Placed under the door where he likes to dig and stopped the carpet from being torn up. Can’t ask for anything better.
customer_reviews.author: Ravenrenee

customer_reviews.title: What's not to like
customer_reviews.text: My cat went to this immediately. The size is perfect and stays in place as she uses her claws to scratch. A bit of catnip always help..
customer_reviews.author: ConC

customer_reviews.title: Cat didn’t like
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I’m not giving it a higher review is because my cat didn’t like it and just would not use it. It was also small. I ended up throwing it away.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cat was not interested in using this scratcher.
customer_reviews.text: My cat did not dig this. She very much preferred her cardboard scratcher over this, refused to use it. Not sturdy, which didn't help.
customer_reviews.author: BURIED IN BOOKS

customer_reviews.title: Cat approved
customer_reviews.text: My three cats love this! It has helped save my door drama and furniture. Very durable. You will have to attach it or weight it down to keep it from moving too much.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Happy cats
customer_reviews.text: My cats love these mats - they scratch on them. They nap on them. I tried a cheaper doormat and they totally rejected it. I bought 5.
customer_reviews.author: K. Mahar

customer_reviews.title: Great for large house cats
customer_reviews.text: Great product and very well made.I have a big cat and she usually tears up cheaply made scratch mats. This one stands up to her with no problem at all
customer_reviews.author: Randy D. Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Buy it Cats Love
customer_reviews.text: Best cat scratching mat idea ever. Got tired of cardboard getting all over on carpet. Cat uses this mat more than toys!
customer_reviews.author: Just carole

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for, a rug of her own to shred. Great size, great material - now if I could get my cat interested in it, it would be perfect :)
customer_reviews.author: Sleepless in SC

customer_reviews.title: The cat likes it
customer_reviews.text: Cat likes it and that’s what counts, U guess. Some signs of wear and not at all rigid. Again, the cat likes it.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great size, my cat loves it. I used my around the leg of the couch on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Elisabeth C. Brewer

customer_reviews.title: Gotta leave things all over for cats to scratch so they don’t ruin everything
customer_reviews.text: I use this on the top of my stairs. The cats love scratching at the stairs so while they walk up and feel that rough patch they can get their claws off. I love it too, I always exfoliate my heels into it hahah 🤷🏻‍♀️
customer_reviews.author: Mar

customer_reviews.title: It's hanging in the cat playpen where Walter sleeps at night.
customer_reviews.text: He loves it, but he also loves working his claws on the backs of our kitchen chairs, whatever is nearby when he gets the urge.
customer_reviews.author: Richardsharon4

customer_reviews.title: Cat won't use it
customer_reviews.text: Our cat would rather use the leg of our dining room table. I doesn't matter how much catnip we pore on it!
customer_reviews.author: Irv

customer_reviews.title: 2 cats - need two mats
customer_reviews.text: I love this mat. I bought one for a new kitten to get him use to scratching on sisal. My older cat appropriated it so I had to buy one for her also.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Hanging cat scratcher
customer_reviews.text: I am trying to get my cat to use it more consistently. I am encouraged that he will use it rather than scratch the bannisters.
customer_reviews.author: mary b.

customer_reviews.title: My cats scratch under it
customer_reviews.text: Decent quality, but my cats push it to the side to scratch the door underneath. It might work better if it attached somehow at the bottom too.
customer_reviews.author: Kudos

customer_reviews.title: My cats like to scratch and stretch!
customer_reviews.text: A bit surprised but my cats love this and scratch that on it all the time. So far no wear showing. And it’s less “unattractive” than some options. I have it near their water fountain so they like to scratch before and after drinking. Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: MuffyMeis

customer_reviews.title: Kinda flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy...when cats clawed it...it came with them...would need to be nailed/stapled to something to be useful
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa B

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves it, and it's a similar size to the rectangular cardboard scratchers we get.
customer_reviews.author: J. Godsoe

customer_reviews.title: YEAH!!  No more scratching on my rug!
customer_reviews.text: My kitty uses it and sleeps on it. I sprinkled some catnip on it right away; maybe that helped......Diego took right to it.
customer_reviews.author: ArndtNYC

customer_reviews.title: My Two Tuxedo Cats Love Them
customer_reviews.text: We have a few strategically placed around the house so that our furniture remains unmolested.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Natural Sisal Cat Scratching Mat
customer_reviews.text: Received the mat and love it; the only downfall is that I wish it was a little bigger but I know it will do the job. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Leticia G Quiroga

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: My cats love it. They scratch it, lay on it, roll all over it. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Kristie Stadtlander

customer_reviews.title: Nice mat.
customer_reviews.text: This this a very nice looking mat. My cats =^..^= =^..^= like it too. Sturdy and purdy. I'm going to order another.
customer_reviews.author: L. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: great mat for kitty
customer_reviews.text: cats are loving great mat, they sleeps on it, they claw it just have a good time enjoying
customer_reviews.author: dat

customer_reviews.title: Perfect if your cat loves scratching rugs
customer_reviews.text: My cat always scratches my rugs so when I bought a new rug, I bought her this and she loves it. No more rugs destroyed!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cats won't use it.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter bought it for her cat, she never even tried it. Gave it to us, both cats sniffed it and walked away.
customer_reviews.author: alissa

customer_reviews.title: Save your furniture! Get this!
customer_reviews.text: In an apartment with all hard wood, I NEEDED this so my furniture would not be destroyed. My boys love this and NOT my new sofa! (Thank God)
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Geiger

customer_reviews.title: My cats favorite!
customer_reviews.text: My cats love it, I am going to order more as I have several kitties. They also love too lay on it.❤
customer_reviews.author: Bess

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and good for the money
customer_reviews.text: This scratcher is sturdy and looks like it will hold up well. My cats don't really care about it but I haven't used catnip which will probably help.
customer_reviews.author: JLR

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality ...
customer_reviews.text: ... but none of my 4 cats has any interest in using it.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: They do like to lay on it but that is not why ...
customer_reviews.text: Our cats do not use this to scratch. They do like to lay on it but that is not why we bought it. Construction of the mat seems good and if we could get our cats to use it I think it would last for some time
customer_reviews.author: John Arthur

customer_reviews.title: QUALITY SCRATCHERS!
customer_reviews.text: I’m so happy with these. I actually used two of these to repair the worn out scratchers that my cat likes. They look like new and my cat thinks I’m wonderful. (:
customer_reviews.author: Animal Lover

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: My cat doesn't like it and won't use it, i put catnip on it and still doesn't attract her. Wouldn't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The cats don't use it.
customer_reviews.text: I think this would work better if you put it in a place where your cats already scratch. I thought it would be bigger than it was. My cats just weren't into it.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Buchanan

customer_reviews.title: Cat mat
customer_reviews.text: My cat would scratch on the corner and it would pull up off the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Chisholm

customer_reviews.title: Good quality!!
customer_reviews.text: My cat needed a new door scratcher, I review some and decided to get this one, I love the size, my cats immediately used it, it seems very well made and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Our cats just don’t like it
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing wrong with the product. Our cats just don’t use it because they prefer an upright scratch post.
customer_reviews.author: w cutting

product_meta.title: Diversity world Natural Sisal Cat Scratching Mat
product_meta.description:
Size:20"x7.8"| Color:KhakiWe all know that cats have a natural trait, that is, they need to grind their claws every day, not only destroying your furniture，but also occasionally bringing you personal harm. It's a tough question for you
Our cat pads can solve this problem very well, It's made of natural 100% sisal fibers and with a firm cotton edge woven, your cat will have not able to scratch and claw at the mat. The underside of the cat mat is made from non-slip latex which keeps its position totally unchanged while in use
Our sisal catnip scratch mat is made of natural sisal fiber, and contains no chemical additives. It is a kind of green environmental protection household goods. It has the advantages of corrosion resistance, acid and alkali resistance, no static electricity and pressure resistance
Please note: 
Most cats will use this scratching mat, but individual cats need you to be trained and induced to use this scratching mat, for the first time so please you can use some catmint on the Scratching Mat and guide it. 

Buy it now! It will be a great gift for your cat! Of course, it will also help you get rid of the damage of cats to your furniture

Cleaning method:
❶ Transfer sisal carpet to the outside and shake off the dust on the surface. Or use a vacuum cleaner
(Tips: before cleaning, you can sprinkle a little salt, with dust suppression flying function. Because the salt can absorb dust, even small dust can also clean up clean. At the same time, it can also make carpets more durable, and always maintain colorful colors)
❷ Eliminate the peculiar smell of pet on carpet:
Add a small amount of soda water in 4 liters of warm water(about 86℉), soak with towel, wring dry and wipe it
Not only can prevent carpet discoloration or fading, but also can eliminate the smell of pets
After you've finished, put it in a ventilated place and dry it
feature_bullets: ❶ 100% natural sisal (woven), High density sewing machine lockrand
❷ 20" lanyard can let you hang in any one of the door handles and can easily adjust the height of the mat
❸ Backing: non-woven fabric and anti slip epoxy latex design
❹ Design and knitting of large size thread, Total weight: 2300g /m²
❺ Overall Thickness: 0.5"(12mm), the backing is plenty sticky enough to keep it not from sliding around
